sen.j: 古事記では、近江国の日枝山（ひえのやま、後の比叡山）および葛野（かづの）の松尾に鎮座し、鳴鏑を神体とすると記されている。
sen.e: According to Kojiki, (Records of Ancient Matters (Japan's oldest historical record)), the deity is enshrined in the Hieno-yama Mountain (later called and the Hiei-zan Mountain) and Matuo, Kazuno District, and Narikabura is where the deity resides.

sen.e: Since Enryaku-ji Temple of Tendai sect (of Buddhism) was built in the Hiei-zan Mountain, the deity also came to be regarded as the guardian deity of the Tendai sect and Enryaku-ji Temple.
